main event: On May 27, 1952, multiple witnesses observed two bright white lights moving at high speeds over Baltimore, Maryland.
interesting points: Witnesses reported the lights moved with terrific speed and changed direction abruptly,The sighting involved two independent observations at 2230 and 2330 hours, with all witnesses agreeing there was no sound associated with the lights,The objects appeared larger than typical aircraft lights and were estimated to reach speeds of 500 miles per hour,Interviewed individuals included Leonard Jones and Richard Bosse, who described the lights as having irregular pulsations,The investigation documented the presence of military aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
witness description: C.R. Weatherolt, Leonard Jones, Richard Bosse
